review_text:
If you're coming to Woodward and need something a bit more posh, this is your stay. There are 3 bedrooms and 1.5 baths. Each bedroom as at minimum a double bed, I'm not sure if the loveseat in the master is also a sleeper.
You will need to bring your own coffee, tea, or breakfast as this is just a B without the second B. There's an ample amount of bedding, pillows, and extra blankets. Toiletries outside hand soap are not included. Kitchen utensils are included.
With that said, the decor is nice, the rooms are designed in an interesting way, and the space is comfortable. There is a blood red room with games, cards, a chase lounge, and interesting artwork for sale. Two bedrooms share the main bath, and the half bath is inside the 3rd bedroom. A common area bath does not exist. Each bed has a different comfort level: one is an older spring mattress, the next is foam, and the master was more hotel level. I preferred the foam bed in the leopard print carpet room. Allergy alert, the comforter is down in the master.
There are 12 places to eat in the kitchen and formal dining. I loved the elevator and stair option for those needing fitness and others needing knees.
The space is clean, near, and as photographed. It's downtown and eateries are as close as across the street. It appears they close rather early. You have to do some light chores before leaving. I didn't remember to take out the trash, but you need to put clothes in the washer, do the dishes, and take out the trash.
Noise? You will hear absolutely nothing from main street inside the house. I was worried about this with the loud trucks, motorcycles, and bar nearby. It was extremely quiet which is something I need.
The price is high compared to other comparable AirBnBs (for instance stayed at Disney world park in a 6 bedroom, 5 bathroom home with a heated pool, full breakfast, arcade room, Playstation 4s, and TVs in each room for only $98/ night. I'm sure they see more business though, so the overhead isn't as bad. Is it worth that price? Well considering the options when the only few hotels in town are booked, I say absolutely.
It's the best thing Woodward has to offer and you'll have a great time, so long as you're prepared. Grab some groceries, some drinks, and some good bath stuff and enjoy.
speaking of bath, one hint. if the tub is running cold for you and won't heat up, I learned that by running the shower on all the way hot a few minutes will fix that. My mom, poor thing, had a very chilly bath. I tinkered around and found the hack for myself.
Have fun! Thank you Jana et al for wonderful opportunity and stay.
